questions.question: If the demand for a good is inelastic, an increase in its price will cause the total expenditure of the consumers of the good to:
questions.explanation: When demand is inelastic (% change in quantity demanded < % change in price), a price increase leads to higher total expenditure (P × Q).

questions.question: The horizontal demand curve parallel to x-axis implies that the elasticity of demand is:
options: Greater than zero but less than infinity
questions.explanation: A perfectly horizontal demand curve indicates perfectly elastic demand—any price increase reduces quantity demanded to zero; elasticity is infinite.

questions.question: An individual demand curve slopes downward to the right because of the _________:
options: Working of the law of diminishing marginal utility
Substitution effect of decrease in price
Income effect of fall in price
questions.explanation: All three factors—diminishing marginal utility, substitution effect, and income effect—contribute to the downward slope of the demand curve.

questions.question: Income elasticity of demand is defined as the responsiveness of _________ :
options: Quantity demanded to a change in income
Quantity demanded to a change in price
Price to a change in income
Income to a change in quantity demanded
questions.explanation: Income elasticity measures how the quantity demanded of a good responds to a change in consumer income.

questions.question: When savings exceeds the demand for savings, the rate of interest will:
questions.explanation: If supply of savings exceeds demand for savings, interest rates fall to encourage more borrowing and less saving.

questions.question: Rate of interest will increase when the demand for saving is:
options: Less than or equal to its supply
questions.explanation: When demand for savings (borrowing) exceeds supply (saving), interest rates rise to balance the market.

questions.question: Self interest, competition, profit motive are the features of:
questions.explanation: Capitalism is characterized by private ownership, profit motive, competition, and minimal government intervention.

questions.question: The Great Depression was during:
questions.explanation: The Great Depression was a severe worldwide economic depression that lasted from 1929 to the late 1930s, with the worst period in the early 1930s.

questions.question: The branch of Economics that deals with economic aggregate is called:
questions.explanation: Macroeconomics studies economy-wide phenomena such as GDP, inflation, unemployment, and national income.

questions.question: The proportion between total income and total consumption is called:
The proportion between incremental income and incremental consumption is called:
questions.explanation: MPC = Change in Consumption / Change in Income.

questions.question: Consumption expenditure directly varies with:
questions.explanation: According to Keynes, consumption primarily depends on current disposable income.
